intro: Tovomita cephalostigma, commonly known as the African starleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Tovomita cephalostigma is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
